title: Public transport during the Cadel Evans Great Ocean Road Race 2024: Thursday 25 January, Saturday 27 January and Sunday 28 January 2024
articleContent:
Public transport during the Cadel Evans Great Ocean Road Race 2024: Thursday 25 January, Saturday 27 January and Sunday 28 January 2024

Events > Racing

  • Jump to Thursday 25 January
  • Jump to Saturday 27 January
  • Jump to Sunday 28 January

Before you travel

Plan your journey using Journey Planner and check Disruptions for service changes that may affect your journey.

Make your journey hassle-free and remember to top up your myki and have it ready to use before travelling.

Plea refer to the Cadel Evans Great Ocean Road Race website for further event information, road closures and accessibility information.

Planned closures

Due to the Cadel Evans Great Ocean Road Race in Geelong, the Bellarine and Surf Coast bus Routes 1, 20, 24, 41, 42, 43, 50, 51, 55 and 101 (Apollo Bay - Geelong) will experience delays, be diverted in both directions and selected bus stops will not be serviced on Thursday 25 January, Saturday 27 January and Sunday 28 January 2024.

Additionally, on Saturday 27 January, the Warrnambool Line will be suspended between Waurn Ponds and Warrnambool, affecting the 11:44am Warrnambool to Melbourne and 1:00pm Southern Cross to Warrnambool services. Replacement coaches will be available from Geelong Station.

Thursday 25 January

 Regional train

Getting to Geelong

Passengers can catch regular services arriving at Geelong and Marshall Railway Station and connect with bus services to Torquay.

Leaving Geelong

Passengers can return via bus services from Torquay and catch regular services departing Geelong and Marshall Railway Station.

Regional bus

Stop changes from 2pm to 3pm

Due to road closures on Bell Street and The Esplanade for the Surf Coast Classic, the following bus stops will not be serviced on Route 50 and 51:

  • Munday Street/Bell Street
  • Park Lane/Bell St (Torquay)
  • Price Street/The Esplanade

Passengers are advised to use the alternative bus stops located at:

  • Spring Valley Drive/Ocean View Crescent (to Geelong)
  • Pearl Street/Boston Road (to Jan Juc)
  • Pearl Street/The Esplanade - West (to Geelong)
  • 3 Great Ocean Road (to Jan Juc)

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

Saturday 27 January

 Regional train

Getting to Geelong

Passengers can catch regular services arriving at Geelong Railway Station.

Due to the suspension of services on the Warrnambool Line between Waurn Ponds and Warrnambool, the following services will be affected and replacement coaches will be available for passengers from Geelong Station.

  • 11:44am Warrnambool to Melbourne
  • 1:00pm Southern Cross to Warrnambool

View more information in our disruption article here.

Leaving Geelong

Passengers can catch regular services departing Geelong Railway Station.

Regional bus

Due to temporary and rolling road closures in place for the UCI Women’s Elite Road Race, there will be delays and service changes to bus Routes 1, 20, 24, 41, 42, 43, 50, 51, 55 and 101 (Apollo Bay - Geelong) around Geelong, the Bellarine and Surf Coast.

Please visit the Cadel Evans Great Ocean Road Race website for further information regarding traffic and road closures.

Stop changes from midday to 4.45pm

The following bus stops will not be serviced on bus Routes 1, 24, 41, 42, 50, 51, 55 and 101:

  • Cameron Park/High Street (routes 1, 41 and 42)
  • Barwon Terrace/Moorabool Street (routes 1, 41, 42, 50, 51, 55 and 101)
  • Moorabool Street/Park Crescent/Moorabool Street/ (routes 1, 24, 41, 42, 50, 51 and 55)
  • Moorabool Street/Fyans Street (routes 1, 41, 42, 50, 51 and 55)
  • Balliang Street/Moorabool Street (routes 1, 41, 42, 50, 51, 55 and 101)
  • Latrobe Boulevard/Fyans Street (Route 24)
  • Hopkins Street/Fyans Street (Route 24)
  • Kardinia Park & Ride/Moorabool Street (routes 1, 24, 41, 42, 50, 51, 55 and 101)
  • South Geelong Station/Yarra Street (routes 1 and 101)
  • South Geelong Station/Lonsdale Street (Route 1)
  • Kardinia Park/Moorabool Street (routes 24, 41, 42, 50, 51 and 55)
  • Kilgour Street/Moorabool Street (routes 1, 24, 41, 42, 50, 51, 55 and 101)
  • Maud Street/Moorabool Street (routes 1, 24, 41, 42, 50, 51, 55)
  • Francis Street/Barwon Heads Road (routes 50, 51 and 55)
  • High Street/Barwon Heads Road (routes 50, 51 and 55)

Passengers may use the following stops:

  • Moorabool Bus Interchange/Moorabool Street
  • the temporary stop at 5 Mt Pleasant Road - inbound Routes 1, 41 and 42

  • Leigh Road/Scenic Road (to Deakin University)
  • Lansbury Crescent/Scenic Road (to Geelong)
  • Barwon Water Reserve/Scenic Road (both directions)
  • Desmond Street/Scenic Road (both directions)
  • 21 Buckley Falls Road (both directions)
  • Buckley Falls Road/Highett Road (both directions)
  • Scenic Road/Highett Road (both directions)
  • Barrabool Hills Baptist Church/Province Boulevard (to Geelong)
  • Sloanne Crescent/Province Boulevard (to Deakin University)

Route 43 passengers may use the following bus stops:

Route 20 passengers are advised to use the following bus stops:

Stop changes from 2.45pm to 3pm

The following bus stops will not be serviced on bus Route 51 (to Geelong):

Route 51 passengers are advised to use the following bus stops:

Plan your journey using Journey planner.

Route 24 passengers may use the following bus stops:

  • Weeroona Avenue/Vines Road (to North Geelong)

Sunday 28 January

 Regional train

Getting to Geelong

Passengers can catch regular services arriving at Geelong Railway Station.

Leaving Geelong

Passengers can catch regular services departing Geelong Railway Station.

Regional bus

Due to temporary and rolling road closures in place for the UCI Women’s Elite Road Race, there will be delays and service changes to bus Routes 1, 20, 24, 41, 42, 43, 50, 51, 55 and 101 (Apollo Bay - Geelong) around Geelong, the Bellarine and Surf Coast

Please visit the Cadel Evans Great Ocean Road Race website for further information regarding traffic and road closures.

articleDescription: Public transport information for the Cadel Evans Great Ocean Road Race 2024.
